availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania
City and County of Philadelphia } SS.

I, Wm Henry Bird, resident of Philadelphia in the State of Pennsylvania, duly appointed by the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky a Commissioner of Deeds, under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of said Commonwealth, entitled "An Act to adopt the Revised Statutes," approved January 7th 1852, for the State of Kentucky, within the State of Pennsylvania, do solemnly affirm that I will well and faithfully Execute and perform all the duties of such Commission, under and by virtue of the laws of said Commonwealth of Kentucky. I have also hereunto attached a stamp impression of my official seal.

figure.ab:
WM HENRY BIRD
COMMISSIONER
OF
DEEDS
PHILADELPHIA
PENNSYLVANIA

W V COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
PHILADLEPHIA
PENNA.
Kentucky

body.p: Affirmed and Subscribed before me this fifth Day of June A. D. 1863.

Wm V. Anker
Commissioner of Kentucky in Philadelphia Penna

Pennsylvlania
Comr of Deeds
Wm H Bird
Oath
Filed June 11. 1863
